page.title: 05Ecology Flowers.
page.content: Many wild flowers can be found on the Busks, between Middleham and the River Ure. These include snowdrops and celandines, berries and seedheads of umbelliferae plants; daises, white sloe blossom, sweet cicely smelling of aniseed, crosswort, sandleek, wood geranium, burdock, yarrow, tansy, comfrey, dames violet, wild arum, silverweed, fumitory,hawthorn and elder flower. In the stone walls are found spleenwort, wallrue, toad flax, corydalis and pellitory-of-the-wall. In the churchyard are snowdrops, celandines, daffodils & later,bed- straws, buttercups, daises, tormentil, violets, harebells, mallow, thyme and poppies. In the Castle walls can be found fairy foxglove. On Williams Hill are ivy & speedwell and near Cover Bridge are water crowfoot, water forget-me-not and wild arum.
